flawed_nl_solution:
Between the trolley driver and his first 10 customers, there are 1+10 = <<1+10=12>>12 people are currently on the trolley
On his first stop, 10 people go on and twice as many people got on at the second stop so 10*2 = <<10*2=20>>20 people got on at the second stop.
So at the second stop he had 12 people on board, 3 got off and 20 got on so he now has 12-3+20 = <<12-3+20=29>>29 people
At his third stop 18 people got off and 2 got on so in total there are 29-18 +2 = <<29-18+2=13>>13 people on the trolley
#### 13

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 11, not 12. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
